meanings.definition: The migration or journey of the Islamic prophet Muhammad and his followers from Mecca to Medina in 622 AD.
meanings.sent1: The hijrah of Muhammad was a significant event in Islamic history.
meanings.sent2: Many pilgrims embark on a hijrah to Mecca each year.
meanings.sent3: During the hijrah, they packed their belongings and set off on a long journey.
meanings.sent4: Her hijrah from the city to the countryside symbolized a fresh start.
meanings.sent5: The hijrah of the early Muslims was filled with challenges and triumphs.

meanings.definition: A journey undertaken for the sake of religious or political reasons.
meanings.sent1: The hijrah to a new land brought them closer to their faith.
meanings.sent2: The politician's hijrah to the capital was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent3: Their hijrah to the mountains was both adventurous and spiritual.
meanings.sent4: She saw her hijrah as a way to escape the chaos of the city.
meanings.sent5: The hijrah of the refugees was a testament to their resilience.
